column2: Catmagick, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had peripheral vertigo my whole life, and no one know what causes it.  Plus problems with motion sickness--I guess  they are related.  This stuff is a miracle for me.  I would rather have the drowsiness, which is actually not bad at all compared to the horrible vertigo, the nausea and the feeling like you are going to pass out if you move your head.  I have been hospitalized twice with this issue, and the meclizine is the only thing that helps. I find that the prescription works better than the OTC, I don't know why, but for emergencies in case I don't  have my medication with me, I always carry Bonine, which is meclizine OTC.  Again, I find the prescription works better, but in a pinch, I use Bonine, or if necessary, Dramamine, which definitely makes me much sleepier than the meclizine.

column9: Meclizine did take away the spinning and dizziness, and vomiting from severe vertigo, however, after being on Meclizine for 3-1/2 days, my vision became very blurred at times seeing double. column2: Leah, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Used before long road trip,and did not feel drowzy as taking Dramimine.My daughter is 14 and experiences terrible motion sickness. Bonine given to her before roller coasters and before long car rides/ plane trips and works very well with her. Bonine is ideal for two reasons, 1. less drowziness, and  2.chewable that tastes pleasent. The Bonine works faster as it is chewed and begins to work very quickly, absorbing through the tongue, thus entering the bloodstream faster than that of an anti-vert that is swallowed. I have even taken one during major motion sickness and it cleared my vertigo/nausea in a short time, about 20-30 min. We don't travel or go to amusement parks without it.

column2: chrisn06, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine did not seem to work at all for me.  I have had Labyrinthitis (Vertigo) for about 2 weeks now.  The first 4 days were just terrible. I stopped taking the medicine and felt a little better after a few more days.  I've been at about 80% normalcy for a few days now.  I went back to the doctor today and he prescribed a different medicine, Promethozine.  Not sure how much it is helping today but I do know it makes me VERY tired.  I'm just trying to get threw the work day.  I hope this sickness goes away soon.  I can't live like this.  Good luck to anyone that has this sickness.

Initally the medication worked, however only lasted about a day, then my symptoms came back. Not as intense, mostly just when I lay down on my right side, or if I look a certain way. I have stopped taking the medication and haven't noticed a difference, I still feel like I have to hold onto the floor so I dont fall off.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: After being diagnosed in 1985 with:Benign Positional Vertigo, my ENT Dr. prescribed this med. for me. At the time, I woke up one morning and had to crawl to the bathroom. No balance, severe nausea. Had to wear a patch behind my ear for about three months along with Antivert(Meclizine) Over the years I have kept an open prescription of this with me at all times. Adjusting some of the motions of my body has helped also when I turn over in bed or get up from bed. This is the only time it will hit me. It makes me sleep a lot but I have made it so far and that was 20 yrs. ago. I take it only as needed.

column2: jo, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had vertigo for a number of yrs. Also had the light headness and fullness of the head. Was given this when I explained how I felt and within 10 minutes the symtoms were all gone, then 2 weeks later went for a hearing test and my ears were tested for pressure and every since have had headpain and fullness of the head.Pills work some, but not like before the hearing test. I figure the ear pressure had something to do with this. MRI came back clear. This was only in the last month and a half. It felt so good to feel like a human being and now back to the same thing. But the pill does take some of the pressure out of my head.

column2: iggy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medicine for one day and felt terrible.  I had gone to the doctor for dizziness (usually when getting from a sitting/lying position to a standing position).  She prescribed meclize for motion sickness.  I felt like I was on a boat for the entire day! Has anyone else noticed this reaction to this medicine?

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had fluid in inner ear for 2 weeks, with blockage of the ear. After 3rd week of this, I woke up sick one morning with EXTREME nausea and almost nonstop vomiting. I needed an ambulance ride to the ER at the local hospital. After a morning of tests, including a CAT scan, I was diagnosed with "benign positional vertigo". I was still extremely ill. I was given an iv injection of 4 drugs, one of which was meclizine. Five minutes later, I was well and after another five minutes, I was on my way back home. The doctor prescribed two medicines: 2x25 mg of meclizine per day and valium. I took only the meclizine (at night); it dried up the fluid in the inner ear, and I had no more problems with nausea.      I have allergies, and something in a southern California Santa Ana caused the fluid in my ear. I routinely take generic Allegra  and generic Flonase for my allergies, but they were insufficient during the Santa Ana caused allergy.      Generally, I tolerate meclizine well. It does not intefere with sleep. I take the meclizine at bedtime. I do tend to get drowsy in the late afternoon, which is usual whether I take meclizine or not.     One needs to know that any antihistamine can lead to urination problems (urine retention, difficulty in urinating) in males suffering from enlarged prostates. I am a 69 year old male with an elarged prostate. Meclizine causes me much less of a urination problem than does Benadryl (diphenhydramine), another antihistamine.
